subsc: General education sector,Sub-national government administration,Other social services,Health
sectr: Education,Public Administration, Law, and Justice,Health and other social services

abstracts.cdata!:
The project development objectives are
            to improve social services, contain the rise in public
            services unit costs, and promote economic opportunities on
            selected, ecologically viable focus islands in four atolls.
            The focus island development strategy is part of a new
            Government strategy to improve the quality and
            cost-effectiveness of service delivery outside of the Male
            region, focusing investments on islands which are
            ecologically sustainable and can, in the long run, develop
            into centers offering an alternative to the capital region
            for access to services,  and economic opportunities. The
            Project does not require a full environmental assessment,
            given the nature and scale of project activities, and, it is
            classified as a category B. Screening and assessment show
            these activities are likely to have minimal adverse
            environmental impacts, and, would not involve conversion, or
            degradation of critical natural habitats, or other natural
            habitats nor cultural property. However, some activities
            may, unless careful project design and implementation is
            undertaken, potentially have specific impacts of low
            significance. These are site specific impacts due to
            construction waste; improper disposal of health care waste;
            and, improper solid waste and sewerage disposal. Mitigation
            measures should minimize identified potential impacts
            through: due care of site selection, taking into account the
            fragile and vulnerable island ecosystems, including
            groundwater hydrology, coral reefs, and enclosed lagoons.
            Moreover, potential impacts on threatened or endangered
            species should be mitigated; and, dewatering activities
            should be implemented in accordance to the Water Authority
            regulations, while liquid effluents must be discharges via
            maritime outfalls. Discharge points shall be established
            through wastewater discharge permits  granted by the
            relevant authorities. Each health care facility must
            establish a Health Care Waste Management Plan, appropriate
            to the scale and type of activities, and identified hazards.
